description: Robust stochastic policy for Experiment 2c (Bank A): post full initial liquidity and use earlier and more aggressive release of payments, with an expanded urgency window and earlier end-of-day flush, to prioritize 100% settlement across adverse stochastic realizations.

strategic_collateral_tree.description: At the start of the day, post the full available collateral to ensure robustness under one-sided net flows.

on_false.description: No additional strategic collateral moves during the day.

payment_tree.description: From tick 10 onward, aggressively flush all remaining payments regardless of liquidity to minimise EOD settlement failures.

on_true.description: Final-phase flush (ticks 10–12): always release to minimise the probability of unsettled payments.

on_false.description: If payment is within the expanded urgency window relative to its deadline, release immediately.

on_true.description: Payment is urgent (within 5 ticks of deadline); release immediately to avoid missing its deadline.

on_false.description: For non-urgent payments, branch on time of day: early, mid, or late.

on_true.description: Early in the day: require a moderate liquidity buffer before releasing to preserve liquidity for later shocks, but looser than previous versions to avoid excessive early holding.
Early in the day and liquidity is ample under the moderate buffer; release payment.

on_false.description: Early in the day and liquidity is not ample; hold non-urgent payment to protect against late shocks.
If not early, check whether we are in the late-day window.

on_true.description: Late in the day (ticks 8–9): use a relaxed buffer so that most payments are pushed out if at all feasible, to avoid end-of-day backlogs.
Late in the day and liquidity is sufficient under the relaxed buffer; release.

on_false.description: Even late in the day liquidity is insufficient under the relaxed buffer; hold and rely on the urgent rule or the final flush window (from tick 10).
Mid-day (ticks 5–7): use a near-neutral buffer to smooth settlements while still avoiding extreme early depletion.

on_true.description: Mid-day and liquidity is sufficient with the near-neutral buffer; release.

on_false.description: Mid-day and liquidity is tight; hold non-urgent payment but for fewer ticks than before, due to earlier late-day and flush thresholds.
